org.svvrl.goal.core.layout

Interface CostFunction

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractCostFunction, KKCostFunction, SACostFunction

    public interface CostFunction
    A cost function is capable of incrementally calculating the cost to be minimized for drawing a graph in a better layout. This is used by the SA layout
    Author:
    Ming-Hsien Tsai

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the name of this cost function.
      double initialize(Graph g)
      Initializes this cost function and returns the initial cost of a specified graph.
      void setName(java.lang.String n)
      Sets the name of this cost function.
      void setRectangle(java.awt.Rectangle rect)
      Sets the area available for the graph.
      double update(Movement m)
      Calculates the difference of the cost made by a specified movement.

    • Method Detail

        Sets the name of this cost function.

      • initialize

        double initialize(Graph g)
        Initializes this cost function and returns the initial cost of a specified graph.
        Parameters:
        g - the graph to be laid out
        Returns:
        the cost of the graph

      • update

        double update(Movement m)
        Calculates the difference of the cost made by a specified movement.
        Parameters:
        m - a movement of a node that has not been applied yet
        Returns:
        the difference of the cost made by m
